tit.e: Ukagaikata (a government officer in the Edo period)
Ukagaikata (a government officer in the Edo period)
Ukagaikata (a government officer in the Edo period)
tit.cmt: カッコ書きの内容は以下に記載されているため、削除しました。→最新の統一用語リストにより、補足を戻しました。

sen.j: 伺方（うかがいかた）とは、江戸幕府の職名で勘定所の一部門及びそこに属する職員（勘定衆）を指す。
sen.e: Ukagaikata indicates the name of a government post in Kanjosho (the department in charge of financial and public affairs) of the Edo bakufu or its officer (called kanjo-shu).
Ukagaikata indicates the name of a government post in Kanjosho (the department in charge of financial and public affairs) of the Edo bakufu or officers (called kanjo-shu) of that deparment.
sen.cmt: 細かいことですが、itsは曖昧と思って「職員」が勘定所の一部門に属していることで訳しました。
sen.e: "Ukagaikata" indicates the name of a government post in Kanjosho (the department in charge of financial and public affairs) of the Edo bakufu or officers (called kanjo-shu) of that department.
sen.cmt: 統一リストその他（2009/6/29）の指示に従い、Jungido をダブルコーテーションで括りました。that deparment スペルミスのため、that department に修正しました。

sen.j: 勘定組頭のうち、2名が伺方組頭を務め、時期によって不定ではあるが江戸時代後期に230名前後いた勘定衆のうちおよそ40名前後が伺方に属していた。
sen.e: Two of the finance group heads assumed the chief ukagaigata post, and although depending on the era, of around 230 kanjo-sho officers, around 40 belonged to the Ukagaikata post.
Two of the finance group heads assumed the chief ukagaigata post, and although some eras are unclear, of the 230 or so kanjo-sho officers in the Edo era around 40 held the Ukagaikata post.
sen.cmt: 「不定」のことが含みませんでした。また、「江戸時代」が訳しませんでした。
sen.e: Two of the finance group heads assumed the chief ukagaigata post, and although some eras are unclear, of the 230 or so kanjo-shu officers in the Edo period around 40 held the Ukagaikata post.
sen.cmt: kanjo-sho を kanjo-shu に修正しました。Edo era を Edo period に修正しました。

sen.j: 伺方のうちでいくつかの職掌に分かれており、天領の小物成・高掛物などを扱う「中之間掛」、幕府関連寺社の修造などを扱う「神宝方」、幕府領の山林を管理する「御林方」、征夷大将軍の鷹狩・鹿狩関連の事務を行う「御鷹方」、運上・冥加・分一を扱う「運上方」。
sen.e: Ukagaikata included following jobs: "nakanoma-gakari" for handling the Komononari taxes and Takagakarimono taxes in the direct territories of the shogun, "Shinpo-gata" for handling the repairment of bakufu-related shrines and temples, "Ohayashi-kata" for mangaing mountains and forests in bakufu territories, "Otaka-kata" in charge of falconry of Seii taishogun and clerical works related to the falconry, "Unjo-kata" handling Unjo (buseness-related taxes), Myoga (tax for use of a mountain, river, lake or sea) and Buichi (various miscellaneous taxes), "Shoiriyo-kata" for handling paying or lending expenses of daikan officers (bakufu goverment officers placed in domains) of the bakufu, "Shomon-shirabekata" for sorting out documents issued by daikan-sho (daikan's offices) or Azukari-dokoro, "Ginmimono-gakari" for checking applications (for building a port or market, for cutting woods, for exclusion of Unjo or Komononari taxes), "Shuzo-gakari" for suprvising sake-brewers, including sake-kabu (a sake-brewing license), and "Kinshu-gakari" for handling muyaku-kin (no tax), for collecting jono-kin (monetary contributions) and for doing crelical jobs related to these operations.
sen.cmt: 中之間掛、 御林方、 御鷹方、 諸入用方、 証文調方、 吟味物掛： これらの正しい読み、不明です。
sen.e: Ukagaikata included the following jobs: "nakanoma-gakari" for handling the various taxes in the direct territories of the shogun, "Shinpo-gata" for handling repairs to bakufu-related shrines and temples, "Ohayashi-kata" for managing mountains and forests in bakufu territories, "Otaka-kata" for supervising the falconry of Seii taishogun and clerical work related to the falconry, "Unjo-kata"for handling Unjo (business-related taxes), Myoga (tax for the use of a mountain, river, lake or sea) and Buichi (various miscellaneous taxes).
sen.cmt: [handling paying or lending expenses of daikan officers] をそのままにしましたが、もっとすっきるする言い方があればと思います。文書が長すぎてと思い、半分に切りました。「無役金」をno tax および「冥加」をtax for the use of a mountain, river, lake or seaで表現するのは確かめるべきと思います。一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Ukagaikata included the following jobs: 'nakanoma-gakari' for handling the various taxes in the direct territories of the shogun, 'Shinpo-gata' for handling repairs to bakufu-related shrines and temples, 'Ohayashi-kata' for managing mountains and forests in bakufu territories, 'Otaka-kata' for supervising the falconry of Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") and clerical work related to the falconry, 'Unjo-kata' for handling Unjo (business-related taxes), Myoga (tax for the use of a mountain, river, lake or sea) and Buichi (various miscellaneous taxes).
sen.cmt: Seii taishogun に (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") を追記しました。ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。

sen.j: 幕府代官への経費の支給・貸付を行う「諸入用方」、代官所・預所から出された文書の整理にあたる「証文調方」、勘定所に属する各種申請（港や市場の設置、御林伐出、運上・小物成などの免除など）を審査した「吟味物掛」、酒株をはじめ酒造業を監督した「酒造掛」、無役金や上納金の取立や関連事務を行う「金集掛」などが存在した。
sen.e: Other positions included: "Shoiriyo-kata" for handling paying or lending expenses of daikan officers (bakufu goverment officers placed in domains) of the bakufu, "Shomon-shirabekata" for sorting out documents issued by daikan-sho (daikan's offices) or Azukari-dokoro, "Ginmimono-gakari" for checking applications from the kanjosho (for exemptions for building ports or markets, cutting woods or Unjo and other taxes), "Shuzo-gakari" for supervising sake-brewers, including sake-kabu (a sake-brewing license), and "Kinshu-gakari" for handling muyaku-kin (no tax), collecting jono-kin (monetary contributions) and doing clerical jobs related to these operations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Other positions included: 'Shoiriyo-kata' for handling paying or lending expenses of daikan (local governor) of the bakufu, 'Shomon-shirabekata' for sorting out documents issued by daikan-sho (daikan's offices) or Azukari-dokoro, 'Ginmimono-gakari' for checking applications from the kanjosho (for exemptions for building ports or markets, cutting woods or Unjo and other taxes), 'Shuzo-gakari' for supervising sake-brewers, including sake-kabu (a sake-brewing license), and 'Kinshu-gakari' for handling muyaku-kin (no tax), collecting jono-kin (monetary contributions) and doing clerical jobs related to these operations.
sen.cmt: daikan officers (bakufu goverment officers placed in domains) を daikan (local governor) に修正しました。ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
